entities.name: DESIGNERS
entities.description: The individuals responsible for creating and engineering roller coasters, balancing safety, thrill, and physics principles

entities.name: excitement
entities.description: A feeling of thrill and anticipation experienced by individuals.

entities.name: centripetal
entities.description: Centripetal force is always directed toward the center of the circular path, created by the track pushing against the car.

entities.name: WHEELS
entities.description: The components of the roller coaster car that make contact with the track, providing traction and stability

entities.name: POTENTIAL ENERGY
entities.description: The energy of position, which is gained by the roller coaster car as it climbs to the top of a hill

entities.name: AMUSEMENT PARK
entities.description: A place offering various attractions and rides for entertainment.

entities.name: kinetic
entities.description: Energy associated with motion.

entities.name: VELOCITY
entities.description: The speed and direction of an object's motion, reaching high values during drops and loops on a roller coaster

entities.name: KINETIC ENERGY
entities.description: The energy of motion, which increases as the roller coaster car descends from a high point

entities.name: track
entities.description: The path on which roller coaster cars travel.

entities.name: speed
entities.description: Speed is a measure of how fast an object moves from one place to another, involving both velocity and direction.

entities.name: potential
entities.description: Energy associated with an object's position.

entities.name: energy
entities.description: The sum of kinetic energy (energy of motion) and potential energy (energy of position).

entities.name: drop
entities.description: The drop is the part of a roller coaster ride where the car descends rapidly.

entities.name: stability
entities.description: The ability of a system to resist changes to its motion.

entities.name: physics of roller coasters
entities.description: The physics of roller coasters involves the interplay of forces, energy conservation, acceleration, and velocity.

entities.name: curves
entities.description: Path deviation from straightness

entities.name: ACCELERATION
entities.description: The rate of change of velocity, contributing to the thrill of a roller coaster ride as the car speeds up, slows down, or changes direction

entities.name: mechanical
entities.description: Consists of kinetic and potential forms that remain constant in mechanical systems.

entities.name: Weightlessness
entities.description: Weightlessness is the sensation of feeling no force of support.

entities.name: track pushing against the car
entities.description: The track exerts a force on the car to keep it moving in a circular path.

entities.name: AIRTIME
entities.description: The sensation of weightlessness experienced by riders during the drop of a roller coaster, caused by the acceleration due to gravity

entities.name: Visitors
entities.description: Individuals who visit amusement parks for entertainment and fun.

entities.name: force
entities.description: The study of matter and energy, including their interactions.

entities.name: loops
entities.description: Circular paths that require significant engineering to ensure rider safety and experience.

entities.name: traction
entities.description: The force that enables movement over surfaces.

entities.name: first hill
entities.description: The first hill is the initial and often tallest point on a roller coaster track, where the car gains significant potential energy as it climbs.

attributes.Height: Often the tallest point on the track

entities.name: physics
entities.description: The study of matter and energy.

entities.name: Circular path
entities.description: A circular path is a type of trajectory where the object moves in a closed loop, maintaining a constant distance from a central point.
